website_summaries.verdict: One of the best adjusters to buy if you don't want to pay more expensive prices for the professionals.
pros: Applies pressure directly to a specific spot on the body
We love how you can adjust the amount of pressure using a simple dial
Good for a variety of uses
Can be used on adults, children, and even pets
cons: Longer recoil makes the tool slower

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit, long recoil.
customer_reviews.text: Effective enough tool. I am a chiropractor and activator is not my typical treatment style - as a result I'm not looking to spend too much on the tool. This is my second budget level manipulating tool and, while effective, I prefer my first only because the length of the trigger recoil is shorter on the first one. This allows quicker recoil and subsequently quicker reactivation of the tool. It might become a matter of familiarity, but I find this unit slower to use. Solid unit for the price and quick transaction.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kresan

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my Golden Retriever and myself. Seems like a silly little nothing machine but WOW.. what a difference it has made in our lives. I had my chiropractor teach me how to use it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Wish you could buy a manual to learn all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish you could buy a manual to learn all the ways of using this - I'm not a chiropractor - but why sell it to others if no manual available??
customer_reviews.author: Mulberrycountry

customer_reviews.title: buy one!!!
customer_reviews.text: saved me many trips to the chiropractor. i've seen chiropractors for the past 35 years, i know when my neck is out of whack. this thing is amazing and wonderful. had it used on me so many times in their offices i knew just what i needed to do with it. love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: This was a fantastic purchase. My dog suffers from disc disease
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic purchase. My dog suffers from disc disease. His back will bother him from time to time. I used this on him during one of his episodes and it helps immediately. My vet was charging $40 a visit for the same therapy. I am able to do this at home without the stress of a vet visit. I've used it on my own neck and it delivers quite a punch.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.June

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item for several months and it does the job of reducing trigger point pain. Seems solid and is holding up well with much use. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mara C. Sides

customer_reviews.title: This is an inferior product
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this cause I didn't want to spend the money on an Activator tool. I had one in the past and was very satisfied but it died. I have been using this one for a while now(about a yr). It is much weaker than the original cheapest activator version. The tip is also not that great, it moves around. I feel like this is a get what you pay for situation. I am going to buy the activator cause this one just doesn't cut it when it comes down to it. It is ok but not as good as the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: rbone

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far. Only used for a week.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to help with small aches and pains. Be sure to follow acupressure charts. Still go to chiropractor for more sever aches and pains. I cannot have spinal adjustments where they crack and twist the body so this helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not an activator, but works in-a-pinch
customer_reviews.text: Being able to make self-adjustments when a trip to the chriopractor isn't possible (e.g. away on vacation), this unit fits the bill. It's definitely not a standard activator though. Still, a decent price. I did pick up a second unit just to have a spare on hand. Not sure how long these will last or how high quality the internal spring mechanism is.
customer_reviews.author: Rick 007

customer_reviews.title: Defective: Activator Spring Broke on Day Two??  Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.text: The activator shipped to me came in a nicely packaged box, but was clearly defective. The inner spring broke while testing this allegedly new unit on day two. And, when I say "broken", I mean that it would not click anymore, so it is unusable. Returning for a refund. So, I am not sure if they shipped me a refurbished unit that someone else had already worn out, but I say BUYER BEWARE. This is a great product but should not break fresh out of the box, but should work for 10,000 cycles or more. CAT is supposed to make a great product and its an effective therapy tool, so I am wondering why this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Walk_the_walk

customer_reviews.title: Very weak..better for pediatric patients
customer_reviews.text: It's very weak, about 1/3 the strength of a typical activator even at it's highest tension.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second activator. I totally abused my last one and it simply died! This one doesn't seem to be as strong as the one I had before (although, it might just be me!). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed with the design and function of this device.
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressed with this instrument. Intensity adjustment has limited range, & most of force goes into handle. I am a chiropractic student and opted for the cheaper non-activator instrument. It works, but I am dissapointed with the devices adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: DenverDave

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Way too weak to manipulate any bones. Compared strength with my Chiropractors CAT and there is no comparison, he laughed when we compared them. For a $133.80, I would expect at least a decently made product but this is not the case here.
customer_reviews.author: HAWAII KEITH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is mt 2nd one over the years, lost my first one. saves me trips to the chiropractor.
customer_reviews.author: Verla Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not hard enough
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would have a better punch to it but it really doesn’t give enough for me
customer_reviews.author: Patricia O Keser

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: The price point I was looking for in an SLI. Happy I got it because it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Works well and does the trick on my knees once ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and does the trick on my knees once I got the Dr to show me how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Blystone

customer_reviews.title: Pretty ok.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have much power behind it but that’s just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I've had for 4 months without a single problem. It's a great product for a fraction of the cost of the activator series
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: The product is made of a good strong metal. It is perfect. I am very aware of my spine and when adjustments are needed, using this tool has saved me some excruciating pain while waiting for chiropractic appointments. The tool is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Riley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Much like an activator tool, but without the $400 fee tacked on to it
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed and is as professional as my chiropractors have used.
customer_reviews.author: tgsc

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this CAT tool for 10 years in my chiropractic practice and only recently had to replace it. It’s durable, comfortable to use and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Bullarky

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Chiropractor uses it and has me hooked on results. No amount of exercise relaxed some muscles that this tool has helped tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great Chiropractic tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and just what I was looking for! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Vangelee Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: works great! Best watch the vids on youtube for best use....
customer_reviews.author: ice cream 14

customer_reviews.title: What to remember
customer_reviews.text: Really gets the muscle to release tension. Just don’t over due it and adjust tip as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several months. Really recommended. Good price and exactly like the picture
customer_reviews.author: Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Almost as nice as an authentic Activator Methods Activator. Lighter weight, so may cause less fatigue for the practitioner. Low cost means less guilt whenever I drop it on the floor by accident. Very pleased. It arrived in god time too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Draysey

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. Light and resilient. You need to know how to work with this otherwise it Will not serve you
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Took 1 point off for it not having ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Took 1 point off for it not having quite the kick as my old Activator brand tool. But for the average patient it works great. For the price it's a no brainer
customer_reviews.author: DrBones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use it to move the scaffold bone of my wrist. Helps the blood flow into my fingers. Keeps me from paying weekly for a doctor to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good tool for deep muscle work
customer_reviews.text: It’s working great. Using for myself and clients. More for muscle work.
customer_reviews.author: Fay Kilburg

customer_reviews.title: I have only had it a few days but I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it a few days but I'm giving it 5 stars even though it's not exactly what I wanted. Be aware that this one packs a lighter "punch" than the one your chiropractor uses. Having said that, I kind of think a stronger one should only be used by a professional. I think this one will help out in between chiropractor appointments.
customer_reviews.author: mooncompass

customer_reviews.title: not that good
customer_reviews.text: not as good compared with other brands and does not have enough power to deliver a good kick. you get what what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Bocsanu

customer_reviews.title: Adequate adjusting tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly adequate adjusting tool, not as good as the activator IV but it does the job for approx 1/5 of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chiromamma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Parfait. Envoi rapide et produit correspondant parfaitement à la description
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to have one that was affordable and not made ...
customer_reviews.text: The tool does every thing I hoped it would do. It is nice to have one that was affordable and not made cheaply. GOOD JOB!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doc George

customer_reviews.title: great. just a little tap and my back goes ...
customer_reviews.text: great. just a little tap and my back goes right back place. Worked for a chiropractic many years. Great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hale

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to be diverse when HVLA is not an ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tool to be diverse when HVLA is not an option. I have an activator as well, there isn't really a big difference. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool. I had a activator that broke and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. I had a activator that broke and leaked , ordered this cat tool, it arrived very quickly and work as well as the activator. I have been using it for a few weeks now and no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: JTech chiropractic adjusting tool (like an activator, but different brand)
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a used activator from one of my chiropractors years ago to adjust my wrists myself. It worked fine for years, but eventually the spring gave out. I got the JTech to replace it, and am happy with it. It is lighter and smaller, and a bit easier for me to use (smaller hands). Since I just use it for myself I have no worries about it not being all metal, and the price differential makes it the smarter way to go, in my opinion. BTW, I am an RN.
customer_reviews.author: Zanne

customer_reviews.title: good value for money
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tool for the money. It needs to have a stronger drive to it then it would be perfect, but then of course I'm sure it would be more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: lozzamo

customer_reviews.title: Not an Activator
customer_reviews.text: Because Activator's are so expensive now, I decided to try one of these in place of a new Activator. I have noticed that it is much lighter than my Activator and also does not have as much power. It seems like the spring in the CAT is lighter and does not deliver the same power as my old Activator. Time will tell if I really like it... I do like that it is lighter. I am a Chiropractor.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen McReynolds

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works ok in the cervikal area. In lower back and pelvis, the trust is just too weak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It has a good thrust. But the rubber tip is a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a good thrust. But the rubber tip is a bit loose. I often have to readjust the rubber tip as it slips to one side.
customer_reviews.author: LIEW POK TZE

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Do not feel that it meets the standard of the original Activator product
customer_reviews.author: Dale Peterson

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: helps to lessen the number of trips to the chiropractor. good quality tool
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's the best works great .its just what I needed !
customer_reviews.author: joann Dzilinski

customer_reviews.title: I have an electronic impulse adjusting instrument that I am using and it is better and has a stonger force so that is what ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price,but not enough force,should have brought the stronger one.I have an electronic impulse adjusting instrument that I am using and it is better and has a stonger force so that is what I am using as a comparison.This tool would be ok for the average back in generaly good condition,not good for someone with a really bad back that gets badly subluxed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: RE: Chiro adjusting tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I could see a difference in using it. It has improved my adjustments.Would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: So far its been pretty good. It doesn't have the punch of my ...
customer_reviews.text: So far its been pretty good. It doesn't have the punch of my "broken" Activator 4 or "broken" Activator 2. But it works, which is more than I can say for my "Activators", and more importantly the patients respond.
customer_reviews.author: krista maline

customer_reviews.title: two stars being good
customer_reviews.text: Have only had it a few days, but find the setting keeps moving every time I use it... otherwise it seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Functional & Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one about 18 months ago. Still works like new. Standard Activator clone. . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great product and way cheaper than activator
customer_reviews.text: This is cheaper than buying it from the actual company. Great product and way cheaper than activator. My friend bought a new activator 2 and it was broken right out of the box, so he ordered one of these too and he loves his.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Phillips

customer_reviews.title: My 3 star rating
customer_reviews.text: We the item was made very well and I would've rated it as 5 stars BUT the highest setting barely had enough "ummphf" to adjust properly. It was decent enough though so that's why I rated it as a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Nancy Coles

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price and works well with my adjusting. Would recommend for the practitioner who uses various techniques with activator being one of them.
customer_reviews.author: alohameg

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have as much power as an Activator 1 but still does the job.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Product is good quality, I should have bought this a long time ago, has helped me alot.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my neck and shoulders to help loosen up tight muscles. Its the same tool the chiropractor uses.
customer_reviews.author: BreannL

customer_reviews.title: A Great Device That's Effective and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this adjusting tool frequently on my wife since receiving it. She has had chronic back, shoulder, etc. pains for years and her chiropractor uses this type of tool during office visits. However, we can now save time and money by doing frequent adjusting at home, anytime. The force is adjustable and quite sufficient for all applications. I would highly recommend this adjusting tool to others.
customer_reviews.author: Retiree

customer_reviews.title: This is so perfect. It is my second one after wearing out ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so perfect. It is my second one after wearing out the first one. I rarely go to the chiropractor anymore. My son also has one. When my grandson was just a year old, he would go get the activator and bring it to his dad and point to his neck where it hurt. It can also be used on pets
customer_reviews.author: M. Gorichs

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works perfectly so far
customer_reviews.text: Great value and works perfectly so far. Have used for it myself and family to great effect. Saved multiple visits to the chiro especially when the sublaxations are minor. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Seah

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a couple months. Couples pros and cons: Pros: Easy adjusting tension. Easy to hold. Light Portable Tips are nice and soft Cons: Doesn't adjust to as hard as activator level 4 probly level 3 Not as pretty as an activator Over all in my opinion this is a high quality product at a reasonable price. A definite buy!
customer_reviews.author: Smaldone Chiropractic

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this item!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase of this Chiropractic Adjusting Tool! It works great and helps keep me out of pain between Chiropractic adjustments. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is pretty good. A few hits on the neck and shoulders helps to alleviate the tension. I still need to see the chiropractor but this will do it in the meantime.
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: ... keep the pressure setting finger pull handle wabbles only good feather is the
customer_reviews.text: dosent keep the pressure setting finger pull handle wabbles only good feather is the price
customer_reviews.author: Victor K.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Works for what I need! Works great for our dogs!
customer_reviews.author: John Neff

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: My dad is a doctor orthopedic surgeon and one of the three doctors who holds this hammer. It really has cured many cases of scoliosis among others. Thank you very much for this product my dad has recovered health of many people.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, but took a month to get. They said 14 days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From Chiropractor to Clicker
customer_reviews.text: My Chiropractor has decided I'm too old (68) for normal adjustments so has begun using his adjusting tool and charging me the same price. Hey! Why pay for a chiropractor when I can buy the adjusting tool!
customer_reviews.author: P. Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We have realized that we need in fact a size bigger
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost worthless as an adjustment device.
customer_reviews.text: I am a licensed practitioner and had never used this model for instrument adjusting. First, let me say if you are in pain, you would benefit more from having a trained person do a full assessment of the cause of your pain. As far as the instrument itself: the force and speed of the instrument are inadequate to obtain much benefit at all imo. I tried to return this but fell outside of the window of time so, $140 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product; works well
customer_reviews.text: For occasional use, this works as well as the Activator brand for half the cost. It is simple, like the Activator I. Just be careful with the flexible plastic covers on the top (where your thumb is) and the middle (where fingers hold it) because they can slide off and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: B. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work very well. Good purchase. Now I wish someone would write a good 'How To Use' book in laymen's terms for at-home use. It's amazing how a little shock to a tight muscle tells it to relax - too bad it couldn't help my mind relax. For that I use whiskey.......:)
customer_reviews.author: S. Litton

customer_reviews.title: My friend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this since 2014. It’s not professional quality but for home use to help me in between sessions, it’s a life saver. I wasn’t getting chiropractic care for a couple of years and it got me through. One part of the rubber handle slipped off for the final time about a year ago but the tip pad is still in tact and I try my best to keep it in a safe spot because I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk. Don’t buy this tool as it will be utterly useless in your clinic. It may look similar to the Activator tool but there’s no way it delivers similar force at any setting. Just don’t waste your time on this
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very weak product
customer_reviews.text: Very weak product I tried to return the product and the manufacturer wanted to charge me with a very high percebtage of the total value of the purchase. This was the worst experience in Amazon ever.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Aracena

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like my chiropractors device.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for extreme muscle tension or pinched nerves. Of course I need help reaching where it hurts the most. Not too bad in places I can reach. Worth the money?? Ehh, for me, not really. But I also have other devices and a husband to calm my muscle tension. It’s great in a pinch while I’m at work.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use it with Gua Sha scraping tools to get out knots and tension to reduce migraines, and folks, this is the ticket. Amazing, has made such a difference in my life, and I recover from workouts much quicker. It's not the most powerful, but I've found that I get to most spots with just a few clicks. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Luce

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: The price is as cheap as you can find for a chiropractic type tool that's for an adjustment. I still prefer the actual Activator, but this works really just as well, and it is well made. There is no reference on how much force your giving with each turn of the adjusting sleeve, so you just have to test it before using it on a patient.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $
customer_reviews.text: Does not put enough pressure. I'm office manager for a chiropractor and he greatly disliked these. Seller did not respond to my email when I tried to ask questions.
customer_reviews.author: becky loyd

customer_reviews.title: First one great/second one used&broken
customer_reviews.text: My first one was great. I ordered another. Second one came used and broken. Package was wrapped in tape. Contents not settled in box. Tool does not work. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tony Black

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for and at a reasonable price. I have several patients with arthritic joints and decreased disc spaces that make it impossible to get satisfying relief from diversified adjusting. Treatment with this tool along with deep tissue stretching and axial decompression increases mobility, decreases pain and discomfort as well as restores function. I would buy this product again in the future, if I needed to and from this seller, as service and shipping time was excellent and the price of the product is appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this activator! Works great, is durable, and doesn't break the bank as badly as others do! My boyfriend has worked in 2 offices since graduating, and this is the activator used in both!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Threads blow out
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a number of these and they work great for a little while. The threads on the pressure adjustment will blow out. It leaves the pressure at full force and some patients aren't able to tolerate it. The product needs some improvement on the thread thickness for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Dr S S Krikorian

customer_reviews.title: Professional instrument
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional instrument. Be sure that you know what you are doing before using. Very well made
customer_reviews.author: nsmi

customer_reviews.title: Buy the  original!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 3 stars because it does not have any power. If you just want a soft tap...this product is for you. You get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: PWilson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for chiropractic adjustment/self adjustment. Timely shipping and packaged nicely. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our office after one of our old ones came up missing. Works just as well as the other ones we have.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: Works like an Activator I
customer_reviews.text: This works like an Activator I. The pressure is adjustable by screwing the ring near the tip up or down. I took mine on a trip and somehow lost one of the black rubbery sleeves covering the finger grips, but it is still fine to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Porter

customer_reviews.title: My chiropractor uses this on me and it makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: I am learning the areas to use this. It really helps with back,leg and foot issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon D.

customer_reviews.title: it works great! And I don't know that I would want ...
customer_reviews.text: My review is that it isn't as strong as a name brand Activator. I brought this to my DC, who tested it against theirs. BUT - for self adjusting at home, it works great! And I don't know that I would want stronger without actual training.
customer_reviews.author: Jesica Dolin James

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing! Use with caution, but Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this item!! I do use it cautiously, using what I have learned by going to years of chiro. I have studied A and P and am a Massage Therapist of old, but I just use this on myself and my husband. I LOVE it. I have saved myself from quite a few trips to the chiro already, so it is going to pay for itself quickly. I am SOOO glad to have finally bought one.! Highly recommended, especially if you have the same issues happen regularly and know how to treat it. You can teach your body more quickly, with more regular repetition of telling where it's supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B

customer_reviews.title: good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This adjusting instrument is not as precise or streamlined as an Activator, but for the price it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Chiropractor!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for a Chiropractor friend in Rome. He couldn't find it in Italy. He told me that he like the tool and is very useful for his job.
customer_reviews.author: Annalisa

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: It's a life saver when it comes to loosening those tight muscles. If you get a lot of neck, shoulder or back muscle knots...this is a great little tool...even if you see a chiropractor regularly...as my family does. It never fails...the weekend hits, the chiropractor is closed, and I have a stiff neck! This little clicker will loosen it right up and make you feel like a million bucks soon after and even better the next day. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This tool is perfect. It works great. The quality is sturdy and durable. I would recommend this to anyone. I use it for self care.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: dont expect it to last
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected but this one was a replacement to one I bought 2yrs ago. Unbelievable I had to replace it already and I barely use it. Worst part is there is no way to begin to fix it... Too pricy in my mind for it to only last a short time. But it saves me office visits to it pays for itself
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Alexander

product_meta.title: J-Tech Chiropractic Adjusting Tool
product_meta.description:
Size:Original CAT

The Original CAT Chiropractic Adjusting Tool is the most affordable thrust adjustment device available. It is designed for greater reliability, increased durability, and provides a smooth, easy operation. This device can be adjusted from 20 to 45 AFR (Average Force Range in pounds-force).

The CAT is compatible with the established protocols you are currently using. With our optional CAT accessories you can customize your CAT to your comfort and the needs of your clients.
feature_bullets: The Original CAT Chiropractic Adjusting Tool - affordable thrust adjustment device
Designed for greater reliabilty and increased durability
Average force range in pounds can be adjusted from 20 to 45 AFR
Test thrust against your hand to find the desired level
